name: Post-Traumatic Myofascial Pain Syndrome
chief_complaint: I have constant muscle pain and tightness in my shoulder that won't go away after my car accident
physical_findings: palpable taut bands in affected muscles
local twitch response upon trigger point compression
treatment: cognitive behavioral therapy for pain management
prognosis: Good with comprehensive treatment, though may require 3-6 months of therapy for full resolution
description: A chronic pain disorder where pressure on sensitive points in muscles (trigger points) causes pain in seemingly unrelated parts of the body. Often develops after trauma or repetitive strain injuries, characterized by the development of hypersensitive nodules in taut bands of skeletal muscle fibers.
